title: Arsenal v Crystal Palace betting odds: Gunners look vulnerable
text:
Arsenal look fragile despite their midweek win against Vitoria and Crystal Palace can take advantage of their poor form

Palace buoyed by last season

Crystal Palace were one of Arsenal’s worst nightmares last season.

Roy Hodgson’s men held the Gunners to a 2-2 draw at Selhurst Park before handing their London rivals a shock 3-2 defeat at the Emirates in April.

William Hill have Both Teams To Score at 8/13 for Sunday’s game.

Palace set up well and have pace in abundance to cause an Arsenal defence that has not improved from last term major problems.

Crystal Palace to repeat last season’s 3-2 score is 40/1 while Over 3.5 Goals is 11/10.

Arsenal’s struggles continue

Arsenal fans will not have had a fun week despite their 3-2 Europa League win against Vitoria.

It started with arguably their worst performance of the season in a 1-0 loss away to Sheffield United.

Arsenal looked disjointed and lacked imagination and creativity to break down the Blades defence, with little to offer over 90 minutes.

The win against Vitoria may not have settled the nerves completely as the Gunners went behind twice in the game.

But they are unbeaten at the Emirates and William Hill have Crystal Palace to lead at half-time and not win at 15/2.

Zaha to haunt Gunners again

Wilfried Zaha has been a thorn in Arsenal’s side for the last couple of seasons. So much so, the Gunners reportedly tried to sign the winger in the summer.

Arsenal bought Zaha’s Ivory Coast teammate Pepe instead, which will only give the former Manchester United winger a point to prove at the Emirates.

Zaha won the penalty for the equaliser at Selhurst Park and scored in the away win and to score anytime on Sunday with William Hill is 3/1.

Pepe finally kicking into gear

An image that would have been replaying in most Arsenal fans’ minds after the embarrassing defeat to Sheffield United would be Nicolas Pepe’s awful miss.

Arsenal’s club-record signing only had the keeper to beat when he missed a perfect Sead Kolasinac cross.

However, the Ivorian’s match-winning brace against Vitoria will have gone some way to restoring supporters’ faith in the highly-rated winger.

His two free-kicks were brilliant and William Hill have Pepe to score anytime and Arsenal to win at 7/4.
description: Betting odds as Arsenal look fragile despite their mid-week win against Vitoria and Crystal Palace can take advantage of their poor Premier League form.
